page.title: 01EDUCATION WITHIN LIDLINGTON
page.content: THE VILLAGE OF LIDLINGTON ONLY HAS A NURSERY UNIT AND A LOWER SCHOOL CALLED THOMAS JOHNSON LOWER SCHOOL, WHICH CATERS FOR CHILDREN AGED BETWEEN THREE AND NINE. AFTER THE AGE OF NINE THE CHILDREN HAVE TO GO TO SCHOOLS SITUATED IN ANOTHER VILLAGE, THERE IS A SCHOOL BUS FACILITY FOR THIS PURPOSE. THE SCHOOL HAS ITS OWN SWIMMING POOL.THERE ARE THREE CLASSROOMS IN THE SCHOOL WHICH ARE SERVICED BY FOUR TEACHERS.THE NURSERY HAS TWO TEACHERS.THEY HAVE AN ANNUAL SPORTS DAY.THERE IS A P.T.A. IN THE SCHOOL WHICH HELPS RUN EXTRA ACTIVITIES OUTSIDE SCHOOL HOURS,E.G. THE ANNUAL BRING AND BUY,SCHOOLS DISCO.
